access: This private 1 bedroom apartment is located on the lower level of our house with private entrance for our guests. There is plenty of storage space available for your luggage.
additional_house_rules:
- No additional guests other than stated on the reservation
- Shoes off in the apartment
- No illegal activities of any kind including illegal downloading.
description:
My place is close to Church Avenue with plenty of choices for food shopping, take outs and public transport. You’ll love my place because of the coziness. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and furry friends (pets). It is self contained and has everything you need for a stay in NYC, complete with Fios TV service and WiFi network access.
Please read the full description of our listing before planning your trip.

This cozy newly decorated 1 bedroom with eat in kitchen (600sq ft+) is situated in a quiet residential area in Brooklyn.
The bedroom / living space has a queen size bed and a full size futon.
The eat-in kitchen is fully equipped to cook and enjoy a nice meal or breakfast.
Upon arrival the fridge will be stocked with water and some breakfast essentials to start your stay.
The apartment is accessible with a private entrance for our guests.
This cozy retreat is about 50-70 mins from mid-town Manhattan, but the neighborhood has excellent transportation running day and night from and to the subway stations along Church Avenue; 2 and 5 trains are the nearest.
And then there is always a cab ( Uber, Lyft, Juno and local car companies service the area).

This private 1 bedroom apartment is located on the lower level of our house with private entrance for our guests. There is plenty of storage space available for your luggage.

We will welcome our guests after 4 pm or earlier if agreed in advance.
You are welcome with any questions regarding your stay, travels or amenities.
We would like to make your stay easy and relaxed and so in the apartment there will be a NYC starter kit to get you off on the right path!

Our neighborhood is a working class residential area, or "Real Brooklyn" if you like. This area offers great Caribbean restaurants, plenty of grocery stores and excellent public transport all just 2 blocks away.
Our favorite restaurants for take out are: Island Burger, Island Pride, Footprints and Lydia's, all very close by.

Our neighborhood has a lot of transportation to offer: Buses from Church Avenue B35 (Limited and local) are only 2 blocks away.
On Utica Avenue is Bus B46 which is 6 blocks away, this bus goes to Williamsburg and makes stops at Eastern Parkway for Subway trains 3 and 4. 
Bus B7 takes you to Coney Island and Brighton Beach in the south.
The other possibility on Church Avenue is the Dollar Cab, for $2 per person they will bring you to the Nostrand Avenue Subway station to catch the 2 and 5 trains. 

Another perk around our apartment is the free parking, in general there is free parking available on our block or in close proximity. A parking spot is pretty easy to find without too much driving around in circles.

Part of city life is getting around by public transport:

Bus B35 will bring you along Church Avenue to the following Subway stations: 2, 5 trains at Nostrand Avenue, B, Q trains at East 18th Street and F, G trains at McDonald Avenue.

Please note: 2, 3, 4 and 5 trains to Manhattan: Downtown is a minimum travel time of 40 mins and Midtown is 50 mins - 70 mins door to door depending where exactly.

Manhattan:
Times Square is 50 mins
Wall Street is 40 mins
Grand Central Terminal is 60-70 mins

Brooklyn:
Barclays Center is 30-40 mins
Brooklyn College is 20 mins
Brooklyn Bridge is 40 mins
Willamsburg is 45-50 mins.
Park Slope is 35 mins.

Car service to:
JFK Airport 20-30 mins
La Guardia 30-40 mins

No Smoking in the space,
Pets are welcome, but an additional pet fee for approved pets may apply.
Please email an image of your pet and a short note about your pet prior to making a confirmed booking.
This is our home and we use the space also to accommodate friends/family when not in use, so please leave the apartment the way you found it.
We have a Shoes Off policy in our entire home.
If you come by car, there is plenty of street parking in the area.
A cleaning fee of $55 dollars applies as part of the booking.

**We do not live in Manhattan; we live in Brooklyn and that means there is some travel involved to see tourist locations. After reading our transport advice/notes, do not give a poor rating because we are 30-60 mins from tourist central; we are very upfront about your transport options, and remember we also do not charge Manhattan prices :-) **

hosts.about:
We are a family of 4 that loves traveling, before residing in Brooklyn we lived in Amsterdam, London, Cork and Orlando.
We are both professionals working in Manhattan, in the jewelry / fashion industry and the stock-market.
We love spending time with our kids, friends and family.
When we get the chance we love to travel to countries we have never been to explore the landscape, culture, food and people.
Our motto is: Life is short, live it to the max and embrace all situations given to you!
We can't live without:
1 IPhone
2 IPad
3 Family
4 Friends
5 Pets

house_rules:
• Check in is anytime after 4PM
• May not be safe or suitable for infants (Under 2 years)
• No parties or events
• No smoking

- No additional guests other than stated on the reservation
- Shoes off in the apartment
- No illegal activities of any kind including illegal downloading.
instant_book_welcome_message: Hi! We hope you will find what you are looking for here....we would love to know what we are doing right, and are even more keen to know what you would prefer us to change.....we are here to help you!
